Subject: Larval Writers Panel
Description: Sometimes panels with very successful writers on them are intimidating or a bit non-applicable to folks just dipping their toes in the ink, so to speak. This panel has writers struggling to find success sharing their triumphs, woes, insights, and experiences with other aspiring writers.  Speakers include:Jen Haeger, Brent Seth, Rachael Acks, Patty Templeton, Clarence Young, Leslie Gulvas, Michael Elliott  - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Plotting vs Pantsing - An Author's Dilemma
Description: There are two main strategies to writing: plotting and pantsing. Plotters spend months and sometimes years meticulously planning their characters and stories, while pantsers just write everything on the fly. Which method makes a for a better story? Does it depend on the story? Come hear the pros and cons of each method and get a general feel for what makes writers tick.  Speakers include:Jen Haeger, Rachael Acks, Suzanne Church, Clarence Young, Jim Leach, Michael Elliott, Matt Betts - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Story Structure: What Is It, and Can It Make Your Writing Zoom?
Description: Got a story that doesn't move, or just seems a bit flat? Can't figure out what comes next, or how to bring it to a satisfactory conclusion? Maybe it Needs some structure! What's the story type- Milieu, Idea, Character, or Event? Will a Three-Act arrangement give it some shape, or would the Hollywood Formula make more sense? We'll look at different story structures, using movies we've probably all seen as examples.  Speakers include:Lithoglyphe,  Ericka Kahler, Suzanne Church, Clarence Young, Charlie Jane Anders - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
